<title level="1" right="Spell 3" pfs="Standard">[Organsight](/Spells.aspx?ID=963)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Revelation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=138" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 120 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

<row gap="tiny">
<row>**Cast**</row>
<row><actions string="Two Actions" /></row>
<row>[somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)</row>
</row>

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 living or [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160) creature that has organs
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You see the target as though it's dissected and arrayed before you. For the duration, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus on [Medicine](/Skills.aspx?ID=9) checks against the target that depend on its organs, but a –2 circumstance penalty on Medicine checks depending on seeing its skin.

 When you Cast the Spell, attempt a special [Recall Knowledge](/Actions.aspx?ID=26) check using Medicine to spot and discern a vital organ. If you have a [Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) skill appropriate to the creature, you can use that skill instead of Medicine. If you succeed, the next time you deal piercing or slashing damage to the target with a Strike or spell, you deal 4d6 additional precision damage. Once on each of your subsequent turns, you can use a single action to attempt the special Recall Knowledge check again. The extra damage isn't cumulative, so making the check more than once before a Strike or spell has no extra benefit.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The precision damage increases by 1d6.
name: Organsight
